diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+COMPACT_JOB_NAME="${BUILD_ENVIRONMENT}-multigpu-test"
+source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/common.sh"
+
+# Required environment variable: $BUILD_ENVIRONMENT
+# (This is set by default in the Docker images we build, so you don't
+# need to set it yourself.
+
+export PATH=/opt/conda/bin:$PATH
+
+export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64/stubs:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
+export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
+
+echo "Testing pytorch"
+export OMP_NUM_THREADS=4
+export MKL_NUM_THREADS=4
+
+time python test/run_test.py --verbose -i distributed
body: What makes it a "multigpu-test"? It looks like it's just running a subset of our tests without doing anything special. Is it treated differently by our CI infra?
body_html: What makes it a "multigpu-test"? It looks like it's just running a subset of our tests without doing anything special. Is it treated differently by our CI infra?
